sounds-good.name: Sounds Good
sounds-good.caption: Generative eye candy and website for the new Toronto listening bar
sounds-good.desc: Sounds Good is a restaurant and listening bar in Toronto's Little Portugal neighborhood. No Replica collaborated with designer Rebecca Wilkinson to create the bar’s website, which features a hypnotic generative animation of shifting geometric shapes.

media.desc: The site’s homepage features a generative animation of infinitely expanding and contracting shapes.
Subpages use a split layout between imagery and text content.
Like the rest of the site’s content, the menu uses a minimalistic design system featuring a single typeface set in one weight and size.
Subpages switch to a single-column layout on mobile devices.

common-dimensions.name: Common Dimensions
common-dimensions.caption: Research platform collecting, documenting, and discussing chairs
common-dimensions.desc: Common Dimensions is a research platform and print publication that approaches the subject of the chair by asking deceptively obtuse questions, like “What makes a chair a chair?” No Replica collaborated with founder Rebecca Wilkinson to develop the project’s website, which features several unique user experiences.

the-talent-house.name: The Talent House
the-talent-house.caption: Hiding a musical instrument in plain sight
the-talent-house.desc: The Talent House is a music school in Cypress, TX that offers lessons for a wide range of instruments. No Replica collaborated with designer Clinton Van Arnam to create the organization’s identity and website. The site employs a heavy black-and-white aesthetic that is brought to life through a series of animations. In addition to the traditional user experience, which spans several pages including instructor bios and a blog, the site features a playable piano embedded within the sidebar navigation.

risd-grad-show-2024.name: RISD Grad Show 2024
risd-grad-show-2024.caption: Identity and website highlighting spectrums of color used in student work
risd-grad-show-2024.desc: RISD’s annual Grad Show is the school’s public showcase of graduate work and theses. Each year, two students are selected to create an identity for the event and an archival website featuring everyone’s work. No Replica worked with designer Emily Bluedorn on the 2024 identity, which featured strips of dynamic gradients generated directly from student artworks. We achieved this by zooming in and panning across images to reveal small fragments of color. Then, we assembled these fragments in a composition of vertical slices, combined with an original variable font based on the typeface FT88. No Replica’s work on the project included a poster generator with an interactive interface for saving PDFs at a variety of print sizes.

the-neighborhood-at-central-synagogue.name: The Neighborhood @ Central Synagogue
the-neighborhood-at-central-synagogue.caption: Digital home for an online community
the-neighborhood-at-central-synagogue.desc: The Neighborhood is Central Synagogue’s digital initiative focusing on congregant-centered worship. No Replica created an identity and website using animated hand drawn elements to convey the community’s friendly, neighborhood-ly aura.

too-much-type.name: Too Much Type
too-much-type.caption: Type foundry pioneering experimental techniques and technologies
too-much-type.desc: Too Much Type is No Replica’s in-house type foundry. With Too Much Type, we design and develop open-source experimental typefaces and type specimens that explore new ideas for digital typography.

highlights-from-the-impermanent-collecti.name: Highlights from the Impermanent Collection
highlights-from-the-impermanent-collecti.caption: Digital exhibition in the form of a video game
highlights-from-the-impermanent-collecti.desc: The RISD 2023 Graphic Design MFA Biennial, titled Highlights from the Impermanent Collection, featured an identity with the aesthetic of green jello. For the exhibition’s website, No Replica expanded on this identity and created a one-to-one digital recreation of the exhibition’s floor plan. The website places student artworks to match their real-world arrangement, including documentary photography from the live event. Visiting every tile of the digital exhibition reveals a secret prize!

this-is-for-you.name: This Is For You
this-is-for-you.caption: A handbook for design students
this-is-for-you.desc: RISD’s Graphic Design MFA program culminates in the creation of a physical book that represents each student’s body of work and creative practice. This Is For You took a slightly different approach. Instead of centering the student creating the book, the thesis centered the book’s likely audience — prospective students looking for more insight into RISD’s program, and into a design career as a whole. To that end, This Is For You is an ongoing digital document chronicling Gabriel Drozdov’s life and career, with the intent of providing useful information to aspiring designers.
